newsitem.title: USA: Netscape announces new international wins.
newsitem.headline: Netscape announces new international wins.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp said Thursday that several large organizations around the world are deploying Netscape software for internal networks and to connect to the public Internet.
The company said major international customers implementing Netscape client and server software technology include Siemens Nixdorf Informationssysteme AG, BCE Inc's Bell Canada, and Sweden Post.
Others include Thailand's National Science and Technology Development Agency (NSTDA), Japan's Dentsu and Fujitsu Ltd, and Mexico's Grupo Financiero BITAL.
In the fourth quarter of 1996, international sales of Netscape software accounted for 36 percent of total company revenues, versus 30 percent in the third quarter.
Netscape said it is now working with more than 20 international telecom service providers including Deutsche Telekom, France Telecom, Cable and Wireless Plc and Hong Kong Telecomunications Ltd.
Netscape stock was off 1-1/2 at 26-3/8 in late morning trading, hitting a low not seen since shortly after the company's initial public offering in the summer of 1995.
